results.title: Senate Control Hinges on Neck-and-Neck Races, Times/Siena Poll Finds
results.abstract: The contests are close in Arizona, Georgia, Nevada and Pennsylvania. Many voters want Republicans to flip the Senate, but prefer the Democrat in their state.

results.byline: By Christine Hauser and Derrick Bryson Taylor
results.title: Indiana Man Is Charged in 2017 Killings of Two Girls
results.abstract: Liberty German and Abigail Williams were killed on a hike in northern Indiana. On Monday, the police said a man had been charged.

media.caption: Indiana State Police Superintendent Douglas Carter on Monday announced an arrest in the 2017 killings of two girls in Delphi, Ind.

results.byline: By Jack Nicas, Flávia Milhorance and André Spigariol
results.title: After Defeat, Bolsonaro Is Silent, and Brazil Braces for Turmoil
results.abstract: President Jair Bolsonaro has not yet recognized his election defeat after months of warning, without evidence, that opponents would rig the vote.

media.caption: Supporters of President Jair Bolsonaro watching in Brasília, the capital of Brazil, as the results of the presidential election were announced on Sunday.

results.byline: By April Rubin and Kalley Huang
results.title: Instagram Users Report Widespread Account Suspensions
results.abstract: Some users said they could not access the social media app and had been notified that their accounts were suspended. The company behind the app said Monday evening that the issue had been resolved.

media.caption: Many Instagram users woke up Monday to a notification that their accounts had been suspended.

results.title: Bolsonaro, in defeat, may now face charges.
results.abstract: Brazil’s president has faced investigations that have been staved off or blocked so far given his presidential immunity. But that may now change of his defeat in Sunday’s election.

media.caption: Brazilian presidential candidate Jair Bolsonaro gestures to supporters in Rio de Janeiro on Thursday.
media.copyright: Dado Galdieri for The New York Times

results.byline: By Lola Fadulu and Nate Schweber
results.title: Takeaways from first day of the Trump Organization trial in Manhattan.
results.abstract: Prosecutors said the Trump Organization and another family business concealed lavish perks given to its top executives in a scheme to avoid paying taxes. Defense lawyers argued the executives acted on their own in their personal interest and the businesses did not benefit.

media.caption: Michael van der Veen, left, a defense attorney, arrives Monday for the first day of the Trump Organization trial.

results.title: What to Do if You Find Yourself in a Crowd Crush

results.title: A ‘Sea of Bodies’: How a Festive Night in Seoul Turned Deadly
results.abstract: There were few police officers around as a mass of revelers swelled. From within the crowd came calls to “push, push” and a big shove, according to witnesses. Then, they began to fall.
